channel.title: MakeHitMusic Ripper - Java app issue
channel.description:
I have made a program to rip a song from MakeHitMusic Ripper in a .net language (to make sure I had the methods right), and have been trying to re-write this in Java. The issue I am having is getting the JEditorPane to go to a song's webpage. It goes to google, or even makehitmusic.com fine. Keeps throwing the filenotfound exception if I try to go to a song's webpage though. If anybody could help me solve this it would be great.
Source: http://pastebin.com/b4n2Uity
I know the code is not neat, I am trying to get it working correct first, then make it neater.

item.title: MakeHitMusic Ripper - Java app issue
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Evil_, post:29, topic:374823”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=470790.msg3446045#msg3446045 date=1293438781]
.net is only supported under windows. If you specifically develop your .net program for mono, and only use libraries available with mono, then theoretically your .net program should run under mono everywhere. But in most cases, you write it in windows and that’s the only place it runs.
[/quote]My friend created a (very extensive) IRC library in C# with .NET, and it compiled fine with mono, no problems at all.[/quote]

How extensive? IRC libraries aren’t exactly platform dependent.

Read full topic

item.title: MakeHitMusic Ripper - Java app issue
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Pwnd:

Shivers at “Oracle” That shit doesn’t sound right, Lothy

I know LOL. I was going to write ‘Sun’ initially but decided I better just admit that it’s Oracle’s.

Read full topic

item.title: MakeHitMusic Ripper - Java app issue
item.dc:creator: @Evil1 Evil_
item.description:
@Evil1 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:30, topic:374823”][quote author=Evil_ link=topic=470790.msg3446418#msg3446418 date=1293472779]

.net is only supported under windows. If you specifically develop your .net program for mono, and only use libraries available with mono, then theoretically your .net program should run under mono everywhere. But in most cases, you write it in windows and that’s the only place it runs.
[/quote]My friend created a (very extensive) IRC library in C# with .NET, and it compiled fine with mono, no problems at all.

That’s fine, but far too many .net programmers just assume whatever they write will work with mono no problem, and that isn’t a safe assumption.[/quote]Nope, but it’s getting there (except when it comes to WPF lol). Moonlight’s even getting some pretty active development from what I hear (I’ve never personally used it, but I’ve had some people tell me it’s came a long way)

Read full topic

item.title: MakeHitMusic Ripper - Java app issue
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Pwnd:

I don’t understand what was so revolutionary about .NET then. Language portability? Stupid…

I don’t know if revolutionary is appropriate. Above all else, it’s there to compete with Oracle’s J2EE environment.
It is a brilliant environment to build GUI apps in though, as visual studio 2010 is an excellent IDE.

item.description:

but I know if C# can, java can do it easier
[/quote]
wat![/quote]
I wrote a noob version of this in C# before attempting it in Java, to make sure I could get the methods correct. I know C# much better than I know java, but each project I write in C# that I like, I always attempt at re-creating it in Java. This one just happens to not want to cooperate with me.

Edit - If I’m not mistaken anyways, correct me if I’m wrong, java is faster than C#. That’s the reason I said java can do it easier.
